cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central Texas coast, away from Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (near Port O'Connor/Corpus Christi)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island; swells also affecting the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤5%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; winds at the port expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port’s inland location; only minor coastal surge possible along the Louisiana shoreline.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rounds of heavy rain associated with the outer moisture plume could bring 3–5 inches, locally higher, over south-central Louisiana Friday into Sunday, potentially causing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and elevated river levels could create navigation restrictions for deep-draft vessels on the lower Mississippi River.
